metaData.title: Traditional hay making with local farmers
metaData.text: Learn how to preserve the valuable hay meadows of Transylvania, wildlife and traditions by participating at the traditional hay making and cow hand-milking with the local farmers. Details here.

headline.title: Traditional hay making with local farmers

specificArticles.text: At the end of the summer - begging of autumn, the farmers are gathering and making the hay stacks which will be used during the winter to fed their animals. Because the youths are moving to cities and some of the people were relocated by the Canadian mining company, the number of inhabitants and farmers has decreased. In order to take care of the hay meadows and to preserve the tradition of hay making, it would be really helpful for the farmers who are still living here to receive some help. This is a great opportunity for nature lovers and those interested in traditional culture and sustainable living  to learn about the connections between nature and farming and help to preserve valuable mountain hay meadows and their plant, wildlife and traditions. In the evening we will participate at the cow milking and have a rest at the farm were the host will make a dinner as a reward. In one of the days we will go in a guided tour of the village to tell you more about the history and the local habits.

images.text: The hay is gathered into small hay stacks making it easy to transport.
The small hay stacks are transported with horses to a solid and flat ground where the big hay stacks are made.
Once the hay stack is made somebody has to climb on the top of it to put a hay crown.
In this way more and more hay stacks are made.
Hay making is also fun and educative for children.
The grass has grown so the field is ready to be worked.
Meanwhile the cows are grazing the fields all summer long and in the winter they will be fed with the hay.
In th evening learn or see how to hand-milk a cow.
In one of the days we will go in a guided tour of the village to tell you more about the history and the local habits.
The accommodation will be in private rooms with bathroom and kitchen access.

specificArticles.text:
Join the hay making with the farmers from Rosia Montană.
23.08 - 26.08.2018

On the first day - check in, get to know each other, see the field, share the hay activities.
Next days - hay making on the field, cow milking and in the evening the farmer will prepare the dinner as a reward.
Last day - guided trail of the village.
*the schedule can be changed according to the weather.
In order to have everything set for your arrival, please make an early reservation. The accommodation is in private rooms (with bathroom and kitchen) for 10€/person/night.

specificArticles.text: 'Hay meadows provide an immense range of benefits to farming communities and wider society. They create some of Europe’s most spectacular scenery and cultural landscapes. Simply to watch this natural, environmental and cultural heritage disappear before our eyes is, surely, not an option” said the Prince of Wales at the European Parliament, Brussels, 2012. Bellow you can see the video were Prince Charles speaks about the importance of hay meadows.
